channel.title: Using a public long for max integer?
channel.description:
I'm trying to make a "vault" or "pouch" to store money in, going past the 2147M boundary. I just need to know the proper way of using a public long to do this.
The server I'm using has a money pouch. I want everything the player does to go to that pouch, trading, duel arena, selling items, etc. When a player sells an item for, let's say 2B, and then they sell an item for 1B, they are losing 900M+ because it isn't keeping their leftover money. I just want the money pouch to exceed 2147M, maybe go to 1T or something.
Any help would be greatly appreciated :)

item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:26, topic:476694”]public long moneyPouch = 0;
That would only allow the maximum to be 2,147,483,647
public long moneyPouch = 0l;
That would allow the maximum to be 9,223,372,036,854,775,807

moneyPouch += 400l;[/quote]
SO wrong.

Have some one read my post?

item.title: Using a public long for max integer?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Mikeyzzz:

I think 2147M is the highest Java itself can go. correct me if I’m wrong.[/quote][quote=“luna-scape, post:3, topic:476694”]Yeah ur right 2147m is the highest.

Yeah ur right 2147m is the highest.

This can’t be true :
I play SoulSplit, and in the bank, they have a “Money Vault” where you can store up to as much as you want. I have 60B in the game and I can withdrawl up to 2147M to bank/inventory out of it. :
[/quote]They probably have something unique with different values, lets say for instance 995 is one value
when you reach max amount of that value in the “vault” they’ll go onto the next value, 996, and when you reach max of that value they start a next one and so on

Just my hypothesis.[/quote]
You all need to research data types much more thoroughly. Java has no limitations. You can make a number larger than a double if you want. Don’t go around saying shit like this if you have no idea what you’re talking about. If anything were to limit the max value of a data type, it would be the hardware.

luna-scape:

Why dont you just make an ticket or something xd and if you click it you get 1m

Worst fucking idea ever. If your economy is screwed up enough to even consider that, you should just let the server die. Or kill it with a guillotine.

Read full topic
item.source: Using a public long for max integer?

item.title: Using a public long for max integer?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:23, topic:476694”]9223372036854775807 is the max value(long) in Java… unless you are using BigInteger.

add this to player.java:
public long moneyPouch=0;
in playerloading,saving add the token to read/save it respectivley.
make sure for reading it that the value is read as a long (Long.parseLong, rather than Integer.parseInt)<–i think that is right. then you add your methods for the moneypouch (adding,removing) and you should be done :)[/quote]

No need for a [tt]BigInteger[/tt].
[tt]private final long … = aValueL[/tt]

Read full topic

item.title: Using a public long for max integer?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:28, topic:476694”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=594856.msg4190242#msg4190242 date=1356721221]

public long moneyPouch = 0;
That would only allow the maximum to be 2,147,483,647
public long moneyPouch = 0l;
That would allow the maximum to be 9,223,372,036,854,775,807

moneyPouch += 400l;

That’s incorrect. Appending the ‘L’ is only a cosmetic feature.
[/quote]

src\server\Config.java:10: error: integer number too large: 5000000000 public static long imthenull = 5000000000; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
I retract my statement, you are correct. I was confused with C++

item.title: Using a public long for max integer?
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

9223372036854775807 is the max value(long) in Java… unless you are using BigInteger.

add this to player.java:
public long moneyPouch=0;
in playerloading,saving add the token to read/save it respectivley.
make sure for reading it that the value is read as a long (Long.parseLong, rather than Integer.parseInt)<–i think that is right. then you add your methods for the moneypouch (adding,removing) and you should be done

item.source: Using a public long for max integer?

item.title: Using a public long for max integer?
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

In reality, it’s not. 2,147,483,647 is the largest number that an int type can hold. This is because Java uses a 32-bit signed integer value for ints. Since it’s signed, one bit needs to hold the sign value, leaving us 31 bits for storage. 231 = 2,147,483,648, which is the total number of values which can be held in 31 bits. Since we also need to store a zero, our maximum is 2,147,483,647. The total range of data which can be held in an int is [-2,147,483,648 : 2,147,483,647].

But, as was said above, this is not the biggest number Java can handle. It also has support for 64-bit long integer types. This type can hold values in the range [-9,223,372,036,854,775,808 : 9,223,372,036,854,775,807].

And finally we have the BigInteger class, which can hold infinitely large numbers, limited only by the physical capacity of your storage space (RAM).

Read full topic
item.source: Using a public long for max integer?

item.title: Using a public long for max integer?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“Slyte, post:9, topic:476694”][quote author=luna-scape link=topic=594856.msg4190010#msg4190010 date=1356700552]
Why dont you just make an ticket or something xd and if you click it you get 1m
[/quote]

Yeah I already have that too. But my problem is, when I have 2B in my inventory, and someone trades me let’s say 1B, I’ll only be receiving 147M. I can’t figure out how to only accept what I can actually receive. Or if I sell an item for 150M, I’d be losing 3M, for example.[/quote]

This, you can fix. You can either make it so if their cash can’t receive the full amount, the trade can’t be completed, or add the remaining cash somewhere else so they can pick it up another time.

Store the remaining number in a long and then make a command or something so they can redeem it again, making sure that they can’t redeem if their stack can’t take it all.

Read full topic
